summary: The Nutritious SNAP Act of 2025 amends the Food and Nutrition Act to redefine 'food' under the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP). It restricts the purchase of certain beverages (excluding water, milk, and juice) and snack/dessert foods deemed unhealthy, referencing the Accessory Foods List guidance. Furthermore, it allows state agencies to prohibit the use of SNAP benefits for the purchase of food deemed unhealthy by their state nutrition agency.
